relation: Alvernia offers weekend trips to sports games, such as the Philadelphia Phillies and other local attractions. Also weekly the college's sports teams have games on campus to attend, club meetings and games such as bingo to immerse yourself in the campus lifestyle and make lasting friendships.
The food is amazing but there is a wonderful fitness center to help keep students in shape after eating from the never ending array of treats.
I am a commuting student and will not live on campus. But while taking the tour on campus they offer secure and beautiful and spacious dorm spaces for the students that will live on campus.

It may seem intimidating taking five classes every semester, but there is a tutoring center on campus to help you better understand any class material you may have a hard time learning while in the classroom.

If coming as a transfer from another college register and attend a Transfer Tuesday event to receive appropriate care. And visit sporting events to become more acclimated with the layout of the college. Ask the questions as they come you, to make sure that you are receiving the attention you deserve as a student.

I am a transfer student from Reading Area Community College. I registered and attended the campus on a Transfer Tuesday and immediately fell in love. I was treated as a family member and not like a business deal.
pageTitle: Alvernia University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {25574=Dorms are very roomy compared to other dorms. Freshmans have 3 options to choose from housing options. One is even a suite, which I will have in the fall of 2010. People are very friendly. I made 5 friends on Connection Day just from the group activity thatwe all did. Also, they help keep you on campus to make feel more homey there. They have so much activities to do., 128455=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Kelsey from Bensalem, PA 02/05/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 4 out of 4 people found this review useful. 2 of 34 Categories Comments Great for these types of students This school is great if you are serious about your education. If you do not care about your grades then you will not get good ones. The teachers are sympathetic and reasonable and will help you in any way that they can. This school also has great Occupational Therapy, Athletic Training, Criminal Justice, and Nursing programs. Tips for prospective students Come visit the campus and check it out before you apply. I suggest checking out the campus schedule and coming on a day where there is either an activity or a game going on so you can get the true feel of what it is like here. Bang for the buck The tuition is a little high but it does have more of a private small school feel. It is a small campus so you get to know a lot of people and
